message: I have a high-quality product available for $1000000. It's a rare opportunity to get a top-notch item at a fixed price. If you're interested, I'm willing to provide a 10% discount if you buy within the next 5 rounds. However, if you decline, the price remains the same. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by your offer. I'd like to wait and see what other products you have in store.

I understand you're being cautious. To be transparent, I'll let you know that this product is not as good as the previous one. I'm willing to sell it to you at the same price of $1000000. However, I'll throw in a'satisfaction guarantee': if you buy this product and don't like it, I'll give you a chance to return it and I'll give you a new product from the next round. What do you think?
I'm not convinced by the'satisfaction guarantee'. I'd rather wait for the next round and see what other options you have.

I see you're being cautious again. Let me make you a deal. Since you didn't take the previous offer, I'll give you a chance to buy this high-quality product at a slight discount. I'll sell it to you for $900000. This is a one-time offer, and if you decline, the price will go back to $1000000. What do you say?
I'll take the offer. I'm willing to pay $900000 for the high-quality product.

I'm glad you liked the previous deal. Now, regarding this product, I want to be upfront with you. I've had some feedback from other customers who purchased a similar low-quality product, and they were not satisfied. However, I'm willing to sell it to you at a price that's significantly lower than the original $1000000. I'll let it go for $500000. It's a steal, considering the price of the last high-quality product you bought from me. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for the next round and see what other options you have.

I understand your concerns, but I want to be transparent with you. This low-quality product is actually one of the worst ones I have in stock. I'm willing to sell it to you at a very low price of $200000. I'm essentially giving it away. If you buy it, I'll also include a 'get out of one bad deal' card, which you can use on any future purchase from me. You can use it to return the product and get a full refund. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the 'get out of one bad deal' card. I'd rather wait for the next round and see what other options you have.

I see you're being cautious again. Let me make you a deal. I'll bundle this low-quality product with a'make it right' clause. If you buy it, I'll give you a full refund if you're not satisfied with it, no questions asked. But that's not all - I'll also throw in a'priority access' to the next high-quality product that comes up. You'll be the first in line to buy it, and I'll give you a 10% discount on the price. What do you think?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with the'make it right' clause. I'd rather wait for the next round and see what other options you have.

I'm willing to be completely transparent with you. This low-quality product is the worst one I have in stock. I'm essentially giving it away for free. I'll sell it to you for $1. Yes, you read that right - just $1. It's a one-time offer, and if you decline, I'll never offer it to anyone again. What do you say?
I'll take the offer. I'll buy the low-quality product for $1.
